Prompt: What is the gravitational potential energy of a 5-kilogram object at height 10 meters?
Completion:
What is the gravitational potential energy of a 5-kilogram object at height 10 meters? The acceleration due to gravity is 9.8 meters per square second.

To find the gravitational potential energy (GPE) of an object, you can use the formula:

GPE = mass × acceleration due to gravity × height

GPE = 5 kg × 9.8 m/s^2 × 10 m
GPE = 5 × 9.8 × 10
GPE = 490 J

groomed (verb)

The root word in this sentence is “groom.” In this context it is used as a transitive verb, which means it requires an object. “The puppy” is the object. = \(\sqrt{([19])([13])([14])([1))}\)
= \(\sqrt{8712}\)

= 93.33cm^2, rounded to two decimal
